page.title: 14The Miners Strike(cont)
page.content: settlement further away than ever. The miners staged rallies throughout Britain, one of which was held at Dinnington, a mining village near Sheffield. Many Labour MP's showed support for the miners and many attended rallies such as Tony Benn, Joan Maynard and Kevin Barron. {Violence}now increases in pit villages and in Dinnington miners smash up the police station in a desperate attempt to get the{SCABS}out. Soon after, Christmas came and hardship of being on strike began to show. Miners began to{drift back,}but Yorkshire, Kent and Wales remained reasonably solid. The police lost respect in many mining villages because as shown on television many policemen savagedly beat up innocent people and on one occasion a defenseless woman was hit. At the Kiveton Park pit the pit
